text: Paul Vaughn Butterfield (December 17, 1942May 4, 1987) was an American blues harmonica player, singer and band leader. His music was usually Chicago blues. In 1963, he formed the Paul Butterfield Blues Band, which recorded several successful albums and was popular on the late-1960s. Butterfield was inspired by Muddy Waters. Butterfield died in North Hollywood, Los Angeles, California on May 4, 1987 at age 44 of an accidental drug overdose. ==References== Category:1942 births Category:1987 deaths Category:American blues singers Category:American blues musicians Category:American R&B; singers Category:American R&B; musicians Category:Singers from Chicago Category:Musicians from Chicago Category:American rock guitarists Category:American rock singers Category:American bandleaders Category:Drug- related accidental deaths in the United States
